text: I like a good problem.
Hi, I'm Sebastien Gerber.

I'm a Managing Director
at Sia Partners.
We are a management consultancy.

For my role, I oversee
data science and AI capabilities
across UK and Ireland.

It's a big focus at the moment
in generative AI, right?
It's been here for a bit,

but there've been sort of major
disruptions recently
that made it come to life.

We've been working
very closely with AWS as well

to sort of release our own take
on generative AI
and how that can support our clients.
Consulting for goods

is something that we've started
developing a few years ago.
It very much recognizes

our own impact
as a company on society

and the fact that we might
be advising multiple clients.

For us, there are some values
that we need to adhere,
that goes towards to, actually,

a more sustainable future
or more inclusion,

and we apply those rules
and those conducts
to our own employees and to ourselves

before advising
our clients on how to do it.

We were both looking
at our own selves as consultants

and recognizing an imbalance
between the number of female

and male workers
we had in our company.

So, we developed a coded language
to actually identify

whether or not our job descriptions
were quite agnostic,

or if they were catered
for a specific type of people.

How do you make sure that you capture
all of the value from generative AI,

but in a very industrialized
and secure way?

Having, you know, someone like AWS
supporting this for us

has been an accelerator, really,
into making this a reality.

We have access
to a number of resources
that our team gets trained on,

but we also have support
from the AWS staff

on specific projects,
for specific problems.

I hope that, in a way,
my role will evolve

and be shaped by the new topics,
the new things that come along,

and I think that this is part
of what consultants do:

being able to adapt
and to react and understand

where the value
is with new technologies

or new ways of working
or more sustainability agenda.
Like, where's the world going,

and how can I make sure
that I make the most of it?
